1.title: Christine & John
1.plot: Determined to move closer to the high school where he teaches, suburbanites John and Christine are hoping to buy a new home in the city. But finding an affordable move-in ready property for a family of six is a tall order... Especially since their dream home expectations far exceed their budget.

2.title: Emma & Kieron
2.plot: With their limited live/work space cramping their style, clothing designers Emma and Kieron are on the hunt for the perfect downtown property with spacious modern interiors and loads of vintage charm. The only problem is their dream home visions are completely out of step with their budget.

3.title: Stefan & Owen
3.plot: Stefan and Owen dream of finding a gracious Victorian home with high ceilings, hardwood floors and a big backyard, and until they do, they're crashing at a friend's place. They say the arrangement is temporary, but with their property expectations way out of step with their budget, they may be living there permanently.

4.title: Matt & Aleya
4.plot: In a year of firsts, Matt and Aleya want to find - and renovate - their dream home all in time for their upcoming dream wedding. But with a tight budget, a long list of must-haves and just a few months to spare, the odds of finding the perfect party home are stacked against them.

5.title: Stephen & Julie
5.plot: With two dogs, a toddler and a newborn, Stephen and Julie have outgrown their home, and are hoping to find a sprawling suburban property where they can entertain family and friends in style. They want all the comforts, including a home office and a pool, plus they're looking for a stylish and unique home that stands out from the crowd.

6.title: Julie & Peter
6.plot: With their blended family of three children, Julie and Peter are hoping to find a sprawling four-bedroom home where they can put down roots. They've got a long wish list and a limited budget, and since their current rental has already been sold, they've got just two months to find - and move into - the home of their dreams.

7.title: Lise & Andrew
7.plot: Ready to leave their long commute behind, Lise and Andrew are hoping to find the perfect home in the perfect downtown neighborhood. They know exactly what they want and are looking forward to being back in the city. The only problem is that their wish list and budget are more suited to the suburbs!

8.title: Monica & Sam
8.plot: With twins on the way, Sam and Monica need twice as much space, and they're hoping to find a sprawling suburban dream home that suits their budget and contemporary flair. But with just two months to go, time is running out... Enter Property Brothers Drew Scott and Jonathan Scott. They promise to help the couple track down the perfect property, but their first challenge is convincing them to see the potential of a fixer-upper. When they eventually opt for a property that needs plenty of work, Jonathan and the renovation team have their work cut out for them. With their...

9.title: Jessica & Jason
9.plot: After a year of living with her parents, Jessica and Jason want to find a suburban family dream home of their own and are hoping to find a spacious, move-in ready property that satisfies their long list of must-haves.

10.title: Janice & Rob
10.plot: Tired of their tiny townhouse in the city, and with a wish list that far exceeds their budget, newlyweds Rob and Janice are hoping to find a sprawling move-in ready dream home complete with a gourmet kitchen and a huge backyard.

11.title: Monica & Kevin
11.plot: With two small boys, Monica and Kevin have outgrown their suburban property and, desperate for more space, they're looking for a modern move-in ready dream home with a spacious kitchen and plenty of room for more children.

12.title: Andrea & Dave
12.plot: Tired of crashing with her folks, new parents Andrea and Dave are looking for a perfect three-bedroom family home of their own in one of the city's most sought-after neighborhoods.

13.title: Raun & Jasprit
13.plot: Newlyweds Raun and Jasprit have outgrown his cramped bachelor pad, and are now looking for an urban feng shui-friendly family dream home that matches their long wish list and expensive tastes. Enter Property Brothers Drew Scott and Jonathan Scott. They promise the couple they can deliver a great property in a prime location, but first have to convince them that renovating a fixer-upper is the only way to go. Jasprit thinks the brothers are out to lunch. That is, until Jonathan unveils his impressive design plan. Using their lucky numbers, Raun and Jasprit then ...

Real estate and renovation experts, Property Brothers Drew and Jonathan Scott, come to the rescue and help the couple find a budget-friendly dream home that can be renovated on time. With a budget that doesn't match the couple's expectations, Drew and Jonathan struggle to sell the potential of an extreme fixer-upper. A tough decision between two massive renovation projects has to be made and the couple finally pulls the trigger. The brothers now ...

24.title: Christa & Sumit
24.plot: Christa and Sumit have reached their limit and want to flee from their cramped townhouse. With four dogs and plans to have kids, it's time to settle into a large free-flowing home with all the modern fixings. But it's never that easy! The Property Brothers come to the rescue helping them find a budget-friendly dream home that can be renovated on time. With a budget that doesn't match the couple's expectations, Drew and Jonathan struggle to sell the potential of a fixer-upper. The couple almost instantly regrets their decision when a string of unexpected surprises hurt...

25.title: Nancy & Rhonda
25.plot: Nancy and Rhonda have been dating for five years and finally it's time to shack up! They're both eager to move away from cramped city living into a serene and stylish home, but the power couple needs tons of space to make it work. The Property Brothers come to the rescue helping them find a budget-friendly dream home that can be renovated on time. With a budget that doesn't match the couple's expectations, Drew and Jonathan struggle to sell the potential of a fixer-upper. The demolition is all fun and games until Jonathan reveals some hidden problems that could ...

26.title: Veronica & Andrew
26.plot: Veronica and Andrew have had it with their cramped condo. With Veronica's maternity leave coming to an end, the clock is ticking to find the perfect turnkey home in which to raise their young family. But it's never that easy! The Property Brothers come to the rescue helping them find a budget-friendly dream home that can be renovated on time. With a budget that doesn't match the couple's expectations, Drew and Jonathan struggle to sell the potential of a fixer-upper. From the second the couple decides between two huge renovation projects, multiple disasters conspire ...

1.title: Dave & Maria
1.plot: After six months of hotel living with their dog and two sons, Maria and stay-at-home dad Dave are feeling the squeeze. Fed up with their cramped quarters, they're finally ready to find a sprawling suburban home of their own.

2.title: Franklin & Heather
2.plot: Tired of living in their cramped condo, Franklin and Heather are hoping to find a sprawling move-in ready home where they can entertain in style. The only problem is their wish list is way out of step with their budget, and they don't want to compromise on anything. Drew and Jonathan promise to set them up with the perfect property. That is, as soon as they've convinced the couple to purchase and renovate a hardcore fixer upper. A rocky home inspection throws a wrench into the works. And once demolition begins, a host of serious issues threaten to fray nerves and ...

3.title: Edith & Fred
3.plot: Since their last real estate deal fell through, Edith and Fred have been living with their son, and it's high time to move on. The couple has big dreams for their next home, and they're determined to find a resort-style oasis where they can live large and entertain family and friends in style. Drew and Jonathan promise to set them up with an irresistible staycation party home, but the only way to satisfy the couple's over-the-top wish list on their limited budget is to renovate a fixer-upper. Drew makes things tricky by giving the couple two potentially perfect homes ...

4.title: Melissa & Joe
4.plot: With their two small children, Melissa and Joe outgrew the family home, so they sold the property and moved in with her parents. But now they're even more cramped for space than before, and it's high time they found their forever home.

5.title: Sandy & Susy
5.plot: With an empty nest and a new lease on life, Sandy is looking to live it up in an urban pad of her own. And she's enlisted her identical twin sister and best friend Susy to help her find the perfect downtown property.

6.title: Chris & Mike
6.plot: After years of sharing a tiny pool house in their parents' backyard, brothers Chris and Mike have saved up a tidy nest egg and are ready to break out on their own.

7.title: Beatriz & Brandon
7.plot: With busy careers and an active lifestyle, Beatriz and Brandon have outgrown their cramped condo. But they're ready to give up on their frustrating house hunt, too. Because after nine months and a series of unsuccessful offers, they just can't seem to seal the deal. Drew and Jonathan are confident they can turn things around. And they start by convincing the couple to invest in a fixer-upper that can be perfectly renovated to their specifications. Beatriz falls head over heels for the first property they visit. But the road to home ownership is paved with unexpected ...

8.title: Anne & Luca
8.plot: Ready to take their relationship to the next level, Anne and Luca are looking for a budget dream home in the city. And while they agree on steering clear of the suburbs, their styles are miles apart.

9.title: Nicole & Colby
9.plot: Married and eager to start a family, Nicole and Colby are hoping to find a picture-perfect dog-friendly home where they can put down roots. And in the meantime, they're squatting at a friend's place increasingly concerned they may never find a property of their own. In order to get the couple into their preferred neighborhood, Drew and Jonathan start by convincing them to buy and renovate a fixer-upper. Even with expert guidance, the house hunt takes longer than expected, and Nicole is determined to hold out for a home that feels loved. Later, Jonathan must deal with ...

10.title: Nadine & Greg
10.plot: With busy careers, three kids and another one on the way, Nadine and Greg have a hectic schedule. They've outgrown their current nest and their top priority is to move to a more spacious property closer to their loved ones.

11.title: Stephanie & David
11.plot: Done living in his parents' cramped basement, newlyweds Stephanie and David are on the hunt for their forever home. They know exactly what they want, but unfortunately their long wish list is completely out of step with their budget.

12.title: Dionna & Natasha
12.plot: Determined to provide the best for her son, a single mom searches for a budget-friendly dream home.

13.title: Aven & Philip
13.plot: Engaged and taking on a host of major challenges, Aven and Phillip are ready to put down roots after recently relocating to his hometown.

14.title: Belinda & Tiago
14.plot: Soon-to-be-weds Belinda and Tiago are determined to move out of their respective parents' homes. And the sooner they find a suburban dream property of their own, the sooner they'll be able to start their lives together-in private.

15.title: Amy & Graham
15.plot: Newlywed power-couple Amy and Graham are eager to ditch their basement digs at her mother's place for a luxurious home of their own. But their busy schedules mean they have no time for a house hunt.

16.title: Catherine & Viviane
16.plot: Tired of couch surfing and ready for a home of her own, urban singleton Catherine is desperate to find a deluxe bachelorette pad. And while she's got sky-high expectations and is notoriously indecisive, her best friend Viviane has promised to keep her on track and make sure she gets the most bling for her budget.

17.title: Krista & Jennifer
17.plot: After being apart for a decade, competitive twins Krista and Jennifer are sharing a cramped condo, and it's slowly driving them crazy. Desperate for more space and eager to put down roots in a new neighbourhood, they're pooling their resources and hoping to find a stylish downtown pad where they can entertain in style.

18.title: Escaping the In-Laws for a Family Functional Home
18.plot: For three years now, David, Isabella, and their two small children have been living with grandma and grandpa. The couple desperately wants to move before they overstay their welcome. But so far, their house-hunt has been lackluster and both agree they're difficult to please.

19.title: Glenda & Dave
19.plot: After raising their kids, Glenda and Dave moved to the country, but soon realized they'd made a big mistake. They've since sold the house and moved back to the city. And while they're currently in a less-than-desirable rental property, they're looking to buy a chic and modern downtown home where they can entertain in style.

20.title: Andrew & Sarah
20.plot: Desperate to be closer to friends and family, new parents Andrew and Sarah just moved back to the city. But their basement digs at Grandma's are seriously cramping their style. And while they're eager to find a perfect home of their own, they're miles apart when it comes to style.

21.title: Derek & Jennifer
21.plot: Expecting their first child within months and fed up with squeezing into their urban condo, Derek and Jennifer are facing a serious time crunch in their search for a sprawling home in a family-friendly lakeside community.

22.title: Shannon & Darl
22.plot: After years of hard-core studying and dorm-size apartments, nurse Shannon and doctor Darl are ready for their real estate graduation. And since they're now expecting their first child, they've got mere months to get out of their cramped basement digs and into a move-in ready space where they can put down roots, raise a family, and entertain in style.

23.title: Nancy & Dave
23.plot: Tired of crashing on her best friend's couch, biker chick bombshell Nancy is hoping to score a suburban pad of her own, complete with a feminine-industrial flair that reflects her personality, and a two-car chick-cave for her beloved motorbike.

1.title: Downtown Dreaming, Suburban Reality
1.plot: When they found out they were expecting, new parents Diana and John sold their downtown condo to buy a spacious suburban home instead. But that was a year ago, and since their house hunt went nowhere, they're now living with the in-laws and desperate for a home of their own.

2.title: New Parents Go Big with a Blinged Out Pad
2.plot: Tired of their nomadic lifestyle, new parents search for a blinged-out suburban pad.

3.title: New Beginnings and a Forever Home for a Single Mom
3.plot: Devoted single mom Anna has had a tough year, but she always looks on the bright side. And though she's grateful to be living with family for now, she's ready to invest everything she's got in a forever dream home of her own.

4.title: Room to Roam in Their Dream Home
4.plot: Carlie and Drum are ready to expand their family, but their tiny urban condo is holding them back. They're hoping to find a spacious suburban home with lots of room to roam, but their sky-high expectations are completely out of step with their budget.

5.title: Big Decisions for the Perfect Property
5.plot: Fed up with compact condo living and eager to start a family, Angela and Ro are looking for a spacious property in a great neighbourhood. And though their wish list is well beyond their budget, they're not yet ready to compromise.

6.title: Tory and Darren
6.plot: Darren and Tory love the city, but with a dog and two kids, they're tired of squeezing into a tiny urban apartment. The couple is desperate to find a spacious family property in the suburbs. And with their lease quickly coming to an end, they need to find it before they get the boot.

7.title: Kristen & Ben
7.plot: After tying the knot, newlyweds Kristen and Ben moved in with her parents. And though they're eager to find a home of their own, their house hunt has been more frustrating than expected. They've made half a dozen offers so far, but every time they try to close a deal they lose out to the highest bidder. Jonathan and Drew step in with some much-needed real estate guidance and it starts with an unexpected course correction. With a turnkey property out of reach, the search is on for a fixer-upper with great bones, but a bidding war soon threatens to derail the couple's ...

8.title: Julie & Adam
8.plot: After 10 months of camping out in her parents' basement, Julie, Adam, and their two little ones are ready to find a home of their own. They'd like to stay close to family, but finding a move-in ready property in the expensive neighborhood is proving tougher than they'd imagined. After navigating two renovations on their own, the couple is reluctant to take on a fixer-upper. And that's when the Property Brothers step in with a plan. First, it's up to Drew to negotiate a deal on a family property with great bones and then it's up to Jonathan to put the reno-phobic ...

9.title: Competitive Couple Is Challenged with a Reno
9.plot: Gabby and Jim are ready to trade their cramped big city apartment for a family-friendly home in the suburbs. And the couple desperately needs the Property Brothers to find them the perfect place to call home. At first, Gabby and Jim find themselves in pole position for an unlisted fixer-upper with dream home potential, but then it's up to Drew to navigate their wild ride through a surprise bidding war. Later, preserving a home's historic charm takes extra-special care and turns up some big issues along the way. Prankster Jonathan gets a surprise of his own from the ...

10.title: Craig & Laurel
10.plot: High school sweethearts Craig and Laurel quickly sold their previous property and are now living with his Mom until they find their ultimate dream home. But that may take a while since the couple has sky-high expectations and isn't prepared to compromise. Drew and Jonathan stage a real estate intervention and convince the renovation-phobic couple to take a calculated risk. Drew finds a rare gem in a sought-after neighborhood and leverages a troubling home inspection at the negotiating table. Later, while Jonathan tackles an ambitious reno and uncovers a whack of ...

11.title: Independent and Ambitious
11.plot: Tired of living in a cramped rental apartment, hardworking attorney Gina is ready for a swanky home where she can entertain in style. But finding a turnkey property in her ideal neighborhood is beyond her budget and that means something's got to give. Enter the Property Brothers. Drew vows to find Gina a fixer-upper with lots of potential and Jonathan promises that his jaw-dropping renovation will reflect her sparkly personality. The house hunt hits an unexpected roadblock at the bank. And later, bad news about structural issues, water damage, and mounting costs ...

12.title: Bridget & Tom
12.plot: When their home sold more quickly than anticipated, Tom, Bridget and their two boys moved in with friends. So now they're more desperate than ever to find a new family pad. And that's where the Property Brothers step in to turn things around. With their pricey target neighborhood already at the top of their budget, Drew and Jonathan convince Tom and Bridget that a fixer-upper is the only way to go. It's up to Drew to track down a great property that will also cut down on the family's daily commute. Later, Jonathan has a mega project on his hands, and admits that ...

13.title: Marc & Ashleigh
13.plot: When their lease was up, parents-to-be Marc and Ashleigh had to flee their tiny Manhattan apartment. So now they're living with his parents where they face a daunting daily commute and the risk of getting stuck in real estate limbo.

14.title: Michelle & Tom
14.plot: The busy parents of two energetic boys, Michelle and Tom are paying a fortune for a temporary rental and need to find their forever home fast. But their taste for luxury means their dream property is way out of reach and their house hunt could take a while. That's when the Property Brothers step in with a real estate intervention. Michelle is already on board with transforming a fixer upper, but Tom proves harder to convince. Drew leads the search for a property with great bones and the resulting negotiations are tempered by a touching gesture from Michelle. Later, ...

15.title: Suzanne & Kevin
15.plot: Along with their two teenage daughters, Kevin and Suzanne are in the midst of some major life changes. An unexpected relocation means they've had to say goodbye to their beloved home and community. And now they're looking for a new dream home where they can put down roots. The Property Brothers take the family under their wing and promise to transform a fixer-upper into a showstopper. During the house hunt, Drew leverages the results of a home inspection, but the savings are quickly reinvested in a faulty subfloor. Meanwhile, Jonathan's main challenge is nailing the ...

16.title: Chasing the Suburban Dream Home
16.plot: Urbanites Sukhvir and Beeban have decided that condo living is cramping their style so they're heading to the suburbs where they can spread out and raise a family. The only problem is that with sky-high expectations and a long wish list, they're about to get a reality check. To right size the couple's demands, Drew and Jonathan step in with some real estate therapy. And before long, the search is on for a fixer-upper with a handsome frame. A surprise bid on a listing they love means Sukhvir and Beeban soon find themselves back at square one. Later, it's up to Jonathan...

17.title: Taking the Renovation Leap
17.plot: Pema and John's downtown condo was plenty big when it was just the two of them. But with two dogs and a baby, it's now pure chaos, and they're desperate for a spacious family property with a large backyard and plenty of room to grow. Drew and Jonathan step in with a plan, and their first job is shaking Pema's fear of renovations. At the negotiating table, the couple's low-ball approach threatens to derail the project before it's begun. Later, when the walls come down, the problems pile up as Jonathan uncovers a series of worst-case scenarios.

18.title: Scott & Trevor
18.plot: Two brothers pool their resources to buy a fixer-upper and soon the entire family is pitching in.

19.title: Peter & Lexa
19.plot: A couple searches for their dream home but first they must agree on location.

20.title: Michelle & Felicia
20.plot: With Dad busy making pizza, it's up to a Mom and their teenage daughter to put the 'Om' in home.

21.title: Michelle & Jon
21.plot: Two newlywed perfectionists land a fixer-upper that's rumored to contain a hidden time capsule.

22.title: Karima & Nooreen
22.plot: A chemical engineer with a jet-set lifestyle, Karima has been working-and living-all over the world. But after six years as a nomad, it's time to reconnect with family and friends so now she's looking for a deluxe urban home of her own.

23.title: Levi & Alysha
23.plot: After years of living out of a suitcase, it's time for globetrotting Aussies Levi and Alysha to put down roots. And since they've already landed dream jobs in their dream city, the only thing left on their list is a dream home.

24.title: Erin & Adam
24.plot: Tired of squeezing into his bachelor pad condo and ready to move to the suburbs, Erin and Adam are searching for the perfect family-friendly home. But while they've got a healthy budget and a very clear wish list, these indecisive newlyweds can't seem to make up their minds. The couple's house hunt proves to be an uphill battle from the start as Adam's lowball approach leads to a series of rejections. That is, until a patient straight-talking Drew intervenes. At the negotiating table, Erin makes a snap decision that could come back to haunt them. During the demo, ...

25.title: Bliss & Jaeme
25.plot: A homeowner's exacting standards have Jonathan seriously concerned about the big reveal.

26.title: Sarah & Kevin
26.plot: Sarah and Kevin spent years renovating their tiny home. But with a baby boy and changing priorities, they've outgrown their compact space and are desperate for a sprawling suburban home with all the bells and whistles.

1.title: Tyler & Lindsay
1.plot: Tyler and Lindsay love their waterfront lifestyle, but their tiny condo is giving them the squeeze. They desperately need a family home where they can put down roots, but finding a property in their exclusive neighborhood will mean compromising on their wish list. Jonathan and Drew step in with a solution, and Drew leads the search for a fixer upper with lots of charm. Determined to secure 'the one', Lindsay reaches out to make a personal connection with the seller. Meanwhile, it's all hands on deck for an ambitious reno, especially when costly surprises in the ...

2.title: Dorothy & John
2.plot: Though a couple's reno budget comes under siege, Jonathan and Drew manage an extra-special surprise.

3.title: Monique & Carl
3.plot: Coaches Drew and Jonathan blow the whistle when a house hunter has trouble committing.

4.title: Squashing Sibling Rivalry by Going from Cramped to Spacious
4.plot: Competitive twins Krista and Jennifer are sharing a cramped condo and it's slowly driving them crazy. Desperate for more space and eager to put down roots, they're pooling their resources and for a stylish downtown pad.

6.title: Chic and Modern Home to Entertain in Style
6.plot: After their last child moved out, Glenda and Dave relocated to the country but soon missed the city. Now back in the city in a rental, they want a modern downtown home to entertain in style.

7.title: Meeting in the Middle for the Perfect Property
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

11.title: An Urban Dream Home for Their Happily Ever After
11.plot: Samantha and Yaron recently orchestrated their dream wedding, and now they're on the hunt for an urban dream home to match. For the moment, the couple's compact downtown condo is cramping their style, and these newlyweds are eager to find a quiet and sophisticated property where they can put down roots and start a family.

12.title: Promise of a Downtown Dream Home
12.plot: With a baby on the way, Christine and Thomas are ready to settle down. Thomas has promised to find Christine her downtown dream home before their baby arrives. But until he does, they're crashing at a friend's place and time is running out.

13.title: Taking a Gamble on a Fixer Upper
13.plot: New parents Chase and Jessica are all about family, but after crashing at Grandma's place for the past four months, they're eager to find a city dream home where they can put down roots and entertain in style.

8.title: Perfect Pair Ready for a Perfect Pad
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Dream City, Dream Job, Dream Home
10.plot: Globetrotting Aussies Levi and Alysha landed dream jobs in their dream city. Now they are ready for a dream home. Drew leads the hunt for a dog friendly home in a trendy neighborhood. Jonathan makes it their dream home.

11.title: Bachelor Pad Condo to Family-Friendly Home
11.plot: Squeezed in his bachelor pad condo, Erin and Adam search for a family-friendly home in the suburbs. The indecisive newlyweds can't make up their minds. A disaster-free renovation finds Jonathan juggling last-minute changes and indecision.

13.title: Spending, Add-Ons and a Property That Fits the Bill
13.plot: Sarah and Kevin want to move from the city to a larger suburban home. Jonathan and Drew find them a mid-century-styled fixer upper and transform it into their perfect home. .

1.title: Navigating Rough Waters for a Picture Perfect Property
1.plot: Lindsay and Tyler love waterfront living. Their tiny condo is in their ideal neighborhood but their wish list is long. Jonathan and Drew help them realize a fixer upper can be their perfect home.

2.title: Searching for Glitz and Glam
2.plot: Jonathan and Drew help busy parents Dorothy and John graduate from his parents' basement into a home of their own. But when the couple's reno budget comes under siege, the brothers manage an extra-special surprise.

3.title: Game-Time Decision
3.plot: Monique and coach Carl have house hunted for five years, but he's set on a move-in ready mansion. Drew and Jonathan show them a fixer upper can be their dream home.

4.title: Collaboration and Teamwork
4.plot: Kevin and Shirley's house sold more quickly than expected. Jonathan and Drew help them realize a fixer upper can be their perfect home. The budget spirals as the couple changes the plans. Now they wonder if they made the right choice.

5.title: Character and Closed Concept
5.plot: After five rentals in four years, Greg and Barbra are looking for a home of their own.

6.title: Modern Must-Have
6.plot: Squeezed into a tiny condo, Debra and Dan with their three small children have dreams of staying in the heart of the city. The brothers find them an older fixer upper and transform it into their dream home.

7.title: Delivering a Dream Home Just in Time
7.plot: With three kids and another on the way, Dave and Lizzy are desperate to get move from a rental into the home of their dreams.

8.title: Condo to Countryside
8.plot: Jessica and Nathan have lived the cramped condo lifestyle and now want a sprawling home in the country. Drew and Jonathan help them realize their dream.

9.title: Unexpected Dream Home
9.plot: With after-school activities and busy careers, Mark and Eugenie haven't had much time for house hunting. The couple has a list of must-haves, but need to compromise if they want to end their rental situation for good. Drew comes up with a range of options. The added repairs add up faster than expected. Jonathan comes up with a solution for the massive fireplace. With the budget stretched to the max, the couple rejects nearly every one of his money-saving suggestions.

10.title: Century Home Showstopper
10.plot: Sandi and Phil live in a park-filled waterfront neighborhood. With the arrival of their baby boy, they've outgrown their one-room apartment. The couple's search for an allergy-free home where they can put down roots is aided by the Property Brothers' plan to maximize the couple's budget. Drew leads them to a house with great bones and leverages the results of a home inspection through negotiation. Jonathan transforms a century old home into a showplace from the basement to the roof.

11.title: Fixer-Upper for Dog Lovers
11.plot: Leslie and Tim live with her parents since they sold their condo. Jonathan and Drew help to find a dog-friendly fixer-upper but their first job is getting Leslie and Tim to agree on location. Drew's advice scores a hot property in a competitive market. A basement flood challenges Jonathan's contemporary design.

12.title: Rustic-Meets-Modern Design
12.plot: A couple feels the sting of a bidding war in one of the city's priciest neighborhoods and later overthinks Jonathan's rustic-modern design.

13.title: Modern Masterpiece ForTwo
13.plot: Engaged and homeless, Andrew and Phil are couch-surfing around the city while dreaming of a downtown home of their own. Phil is hands-on, Andrew has an eye for design, and er with the Property Brothers, transform a dog-friendly fixer-upper into their dream home. A low ball offer leads to a surprising outcome. A total gut job results in a blank slate for Andrew's modernist vision.

1.title: Hunting for the One
1.plot: The brothers work within a limited search area to find a couple the perfect fixer-upper they can turn into a midcentury modern masterpiece.

2.title: Lakeside Dreaming
2.plot: A couple's hunt for an equestrian chic home in their upscale lakefront community is completed after a surprise contribution from an unexpected source.

3.title: Miles Apart
3.plot: A house-hunting couple tries to move closer to family and friends but quickly runs into budget issues and a snag at city hall.

4.title: Craving More Space for the Family
4.plot: Jonathan and Drew accelerate the house hunt for a family of four. Jonathan's determined to deliver a family-friendly space for entertaining, but his budget goes out the window after the design-challenged homeowner goes rogue.

5.title: Changing Direction
5.plot: Frustrated by their urban house hunt, a couple agrees to a radically different approach as Jonathan and Drew take them on a tour of an amazing rural community that's just a short train ride away.

6.title: Honeymooning and House Hunting
6.plot: Newlyweds with a mile-long wish list are determined to move out of their cramped condo even if it means dealing with asbestos, ancient wiring and structural issues.

7.title: Straightening Out a Sagging Century Home
7.plot: A family of five searches for a forever home in their high-demand school district while dealing with a renovation that quickly gets thrown off track.

8.title: Building a Solid Foundation
8.plot: The Brothers attempt to combine a couple's different wish lists to help them put down roots in their Nashville dream home.

9.title: A Different Dream
9.plot: A single mom searches for a more manageable property after selling her sprawling Nashville dream home.

10.title: Big City Move
10.plot: A busy woman encounters unexpected repairs that slow down the transformation of her cozy and relaxing pad in an up-and-coming Nashville neighborhood.

11.title: Overcoming Analysis Paralysis
11.plot: After finding an off-the-market solution for a new home, Jonathan helps a woman tackle an ambitious renovation with a growing list of add-ons.

12.title: Shaky Start
12.plot: Empty nesters try to find a deluxe retreat where they can hang out with their grandchildren in style.

1.title: Costly Charm for a Vintage Dreamer
1.plot: An up-and-coming musician is ready to settle down in Nashville. It's up to Drew to find a home with loads of vintage charm, while it's Jonathan's job to transform a vintage abode into a hip home without breaking the bank.

2.title: Searching for the Heart of the Home
2.plot: A homesick couple from Wisconsin is ready to put down roots in Nashville. Drew leads the hunt for a a midcentury modern gem, while Jonathan starts a massive renovation that includes a second master suite for an aging dad.

3.title: Mad About Plaid
3.plot: A family of four has been living with Grandma to support her through a tough time, but now they're ready for a house of their own. After finding a fixer-upper with great bones, a slew of big-ticket surprises eat into the budget.

4.title: Family Above All Else
4.plot: After moving back to his hometown of Nashville, a couple is desperate to get out of his childhood bedroom and into a kid-friendly dream home. Drew and Jonathan help them find a house and make some critical design choices.

5.title: Striking the Right Chord
5.plot: A young family is living in her dad's cramped condo while looking for a home near Nashville's Music Row. Drew finds them a place despite the hot market, but a bulging basement wall threatens to bring down the budget and the house.

6.title: Expecting the Unexpected
6.plot: Newlyweds hunt for a sprawling urban home where they can raise a family. Because their condo sold faster than expected, Drew signs on for an express house hunt. Then, Jonathan must find them a style compromise.

7.title: Floored by the Renovation
7.plot: A couple that's ready to end their home search hopes Drew and Jonathan can turn their luck around, but their hunt for a pedestrian-friendly property ends with a calculated risk that could have major consequences down the line.

8.title: Country Chic for a New Generation
8.plot: A couple hunts for a rural retirement home with plenty of room to entertain. Finding a property that fits their wish list proves tricky for Drew and Jonathan, until their search leads back to a family homestead from the past.

9.title: Mistress of Her Domain
9.plot: A buyer looking for a fresh start hunts for a modern turnkey property to be her new home base. The search is on for a two-story home in the same community, but Jonathan and Drew convince her to make a move she never saw coming.

10.title: Uplift and Electrify
10.plot: A family of four hunts for a sprawling dream home to call their own. Jonathan and Drew lead the search for the deluxe suburban pad, but it's a tall order even with the family's big budget.

11.title: Tight Transformation
11.plot: Drew helps a discouraged couple with twin toddlers find a great home in their school district, but the seller's counter offer raises eyebrows and the budget. It's up to Jonathan to find the savings to deliver the transformation.

12.title: Wishful Building
12.plot: A family is ready to trade in their townhouse for a forever home, causing the brothers to juggle their growing wish list. After Drew leverages a deal, Jonathan works with a family member to give the interior heart and soul.

13.title: Episode #12.13
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: The High Cost of Cool
1.plot: Downtown dwellers give up their tiny urban condo to find a detached home with more space. Drew finds a midcentury home, but when the walls come down, they discover a toxic disaster that stretches to every corner of the house.

2.title: Structural Opportunty
2.plot: A couple with a toddler and newborn are ready to move out of his old bachelor pad condo and into a dream home. Jonathan works to transform a century-old property while finding a style compromise that suits their opposing tastes.

3.title: Reno Interrupted
3.plot: A couple is eager to move on in a new home after a family crisis. The Property Brothers try to convince them to see dream-home potential in an unfinished DIY disaster, then it's up to Jonathan to deliver a dazzling renovation.

4.title: Wide Open Dreams
4.plot: After frequent moves and a too-small apartment, Drew helps a Nashville couple find a home where they can settle down with their two boys. Jonathan surprises them with an accessible design for their youngest son's special needs.

5.title: Color Clash
5.plot: After years of moving around the country, a couple is ready to call Nashville home, and Drew finds them a fixer-upper with potential to be a forever home. Jonathan manages budget concerns and hustles to finish before a party.

12.title: Home with a View
12.plot: A couple has a tough decision choosing their forever home in a popular lakefront community outside of Nashville. Jonathan saves the vaulted ceiling, but an electrical issue emerges after the contingency fund is spent on upgrades.

13.title: A Little Bit of Home
13.plot: The brothers help a Nashville family find a large forever home.

-1.title: Putting the 'OM' in Home
-1.plot: Michelle and Michael are busy entrepreneurs and parents of teenagers who have outgrown their awkward townhouse. Michelle and 16-year-old daughter Felicia join forces to find and renovate the perfect home for their entire family.

imdb.plot outline: The Property Brothers are determined to help couples find, buy and transform extreme fixer-uppers into the ultimate dream home. And since it's hard to see beyond a dated property's shortcomings, they're using state-of-the-art CGI to reveal their vision of the future. Can Drew Scott and Jonathan Silver Scott convince these hesitant home buyers to take a radical risk? And can they complete their ambitious project on time and on budget?
imdb.title: Property Brothers
plot: The _Property Brothers_ (qv) are determined to help couples find, buy and transform extreme fixer-uppers into the ultimate dream home. And since it's hard to see beyond a dated property's shortcomings, they're using state-of-the-art CGI to reveal their vision of the future. Can 'Drew Scott' (qv) and 'Jonathan Silver Scott' (qv) convince these hesitant home buyers to take a radical risk? And can they complete their ambitious project on time and on budget?::Cineflix Productions [ca]
